survey_brief: This survey aims to assess employee satisfaction with current workplace ergonomics and its perceived impact on productivity and well-being.

questions.question_text: How satisfied are you with the ergonomic setup of your current workstation (e.g., chair, desk, monitor height)?
questions.client_notes: Use a 5-point Likert scale for consistency; ensure mobile-friendly vertical layout.

script.question_text: How satisfied are you with the ergonomic setup of your current workstation (e.g., chair, desk, monitor height)?

questions.question_text: Which of the following ergonomic issues have you experienced in the past 6 months? (Select all that apply)
questions.client_notes: Multi-select with 'None of the above' as an exclusive option; randomize option order.
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: checkboxes (multi-choice) with validation to prevent 'None' + other selections.

script.question_text: Which of the following ergonomic issues have you experienced in the past 6 months? (Select all that apply)

questions.question_text: How often do you take breaks to stretch or adjust your posture during a typical workday?
questions.client_notes: Include 'Prefer not to answer' if sensitive; use horizontal layout for desktop.
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: radio buttons (single-choice) with 'Other' open-text option.

script.question_text: How often do you take breaks to stretch or adjust your posture during a typical workday?

questions.question_text: What additional ergonomic equipment would improve your work experience? (e.g., standing desk, ergonomic keyboard)
questions.routing_logic: Shown if Q1 response is 'Somewhat dissatisfied' or 'Very dissatisfied'
questions.client_notes: Open-ended to capture specific needs; limit to 200 characters.
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: open-text with character counter.

script.question_text: What additional ergonomic equipment would improve your work experience? (e.g., standing desk, ergonomic keyboard)

questions.question_text: To what extent do you believe better ergonomics would increase your productivity?
